newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch customs make record ecstasy pill seizure.
newsitem.headline: Dutch customs make record ecstasy pill seizure.

text.p: The Dutch customs service on Friday announced it biggest seizure of ecstasy pills.
Customs officers at Amsterdam's Schiphol airport discovered 97,000 pills in a single suitcase a week ago while conducting standard checks on the luggage of departing passengers.
"It was a routine control. We have had them for several months now for outgoing passengers," a customs spokesman said.
The discovery came when a 37-year-old Indonesian man tried to check-in his overweight luggage on a flight to Malaysia.
The street value of the haul in East Asia has been put at around 10 million guilders ($5.2 million).
"The value is four times more there than in the Netherlands," the spokesman said.
Ecstasy -- a synthetic drug declared illegal in the Netherlands in 1988 -- produces a sense of euphoria among users and is popular on the dance club scene. ($ = 1.937 Dutch Guilders)
